p: GPx is an endogenous antioxidant enzyme that catalyses the dismutation of H 2O 2 into O 2 and H 2O. As shown in Fig. 4c, PC-12 cells treated with 400 μM corticosterone significantly reduced the GPx activity to 83.05 ± 4.63% or 1.2-fold lower compared to negative control ( p < 0.05). However, pre-treatment with 0.25 mg/mL HESAE did not increase the activity ( p > 0.05). Therefore, higher concentrations of HESAE at 0.5 and 1 mg/mL were tested for GPx activity. Nevertheless, the concentrations failed to restore the depleted activity. All tested concentrations of HESAE exhibited 1.2 to 2.0-fold lower in the activity compared to desipramine ( p < 0.05).
